definitions.meaning:
[c] ~ (of sth)团；块；堆
a large amount of a substance that does not have a definite shape or form

examples.content:
a mass of snow and rocks falling down the mountain
从山上滚下来的一堆积雪和石块

definitions.meaning:
[c][ususing] ~ of sth大量；许多
a large amount or quantity of sth

examples.content:
a mass of blonde hair
一头金发

I began sifting through the mass of evidence.
我开始认真筛选大量的证据。

definitions.meaning:
[sing]~ of sth（常指混乱的）一群，一堆
a large number of people or things grouped together, often in a confused way

examples.content:
I struggled through the mass of people to the exit.
我在人群里挤来挤去，挤到了出口处。

definitions.meaning:
[pl] ~ (of sth)大量的东西
a large number or amount of sth

examples.content:
I've got masses of work to do.
我有一大堆的工作要做。

Don't give me any more. I've eaten masses!
别再给我了，我已经吃了很多了

definitions.meaning:
[pl]群众；平民百姓
the ordinary people in society 
who are not leaders or who are considered to be not very well educated

examples.content:
a TV programme that brings science to the masses
普及科学知识的电视节目

definitions.meaning:
[sing]大多数；多数
the most; the majority

examples.content:
The reforms are unpopular with the mass of teachers and parents.
大多数教师和家长并不赞成这些改革。

definitions.meaning:
[u]质量
the quantity of material that sth contains

examples.content:
calculating the mass of a planet
计算一个行星的质量

definitions.meaning:
[obn]大批的；数量极多的；广泛的
affecting or involving a large number of people or things

examples.content:
mass unemployment/production
大批失业；批量生产

weapons of mass destruction
大规模杀伤性武器

Demonstrators had massed outside the embassy.
示威者聚集在大使馆的外面。

Dark clouds massed on the horizon.
天边乌云密布。
